findings.title: The forecall and forecallWithToken can be called repeatedly with a same payload
findings.description: High severity issue related to data validation

findings.title: M1: The tokenAddress is missing zero-address check
findings.description: The contract does not perform any data validation of `tokenAddress` in its constructor.

findings.title: M2: TokenLinker has insufficient data validation
W1: Usage of solc optimizer
findings.description: The project uses `solc` optimizer which may lead to unexpected bugs and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: W2: Floating dependency on AxelarGateway
findings.description: The configuration file `package.json` is holding a floating dependency on AxelarGateway which can lead to deployment with an unwanted version if minor or patch updates are not properly tested.

findings.title: W3: Mulitple ways to receive ether can lead to loss of funds
findings.description: The contract uses two balances, a real balance and a storage slot balance, which can cause inconsistency between transactions if not atomic, leading to potential fund loss.

findings.title: W4: The forecall function is missing any checks by default
findings.description: The contract is abstract and the `_checkForecall` function is left unimplemented, presenting a risk because there are no default checks, allowing execution logic to be arbitrarily triggered by anyone.

findings.title: I1: Typo in the error name
findings.description: The error name `TranferFromNativeFailed` should be probably `TransferFromNativeFailed`. Fix the typo.
